definition: to withdraw
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from
lit. to retreat three day's march (idiom); fig. to give way in the face of superior strength/a strategic withdrawal

sentences.english: He says prospective fathers-in-law are put off by his career.
sentences.chinese: 他说女孩子的父亲都因他的事业对他退避三舍。

sentences.english: Siegfried cringed and shrank against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 西格弗里德畏缩了，退避到墙根。

sentences.english: Wisdom consists in learning when to evade and when to oppose head-on.
sentences.chinese: 明智在于懂得何时应退避三舍，何时应迎难而上。

sentences.english: People avoided him, but the dogs hung out with him.
sentences.chinese: 虽然人们都对他退避三舍，但是狗却乐于和他结伴。

sentences.english: Unsurprisingly, Young would soon retreat from the runaway success of this album.
sentences.chinese: 扬能很快从这张专辑瞬息的成功中退避出来不足为奇。

sentences.english: Standing back is not doing the country or his party any good.
sentences.chinese: 退避一旁对这个国家和他的政党没有任何益处。

sentences.english: The annoying habits and bad character traits seem to recede into the background.
sentences.chinese: 原来那些令人讨厌的习惯和坏脾气似乎都退避三舍。

definition: to retreat/to shrink back
lit. to retreat three day's march (idiom); fig. to give way in the face of superior strength/a strategic withdrawal
to jump out of the way
to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
to dodge/to evade
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to escape/to disappear
to dodge/to sidestep
to pull back (an army)/to retreat
to get out of the way
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to flee/to run away
to be scared out of one's wits (idiom)
